content.description:
Root Canal looks harder than it is. Climb the chimney in the center of the middle tooth under and past a couple of chockstones. At the top, exit left onto the summit of the Middle Tooth.

This is super easy climbing with almost no exposure. This would be a great first trad lead.

Don't forget to sign the summit register.
content.protection: A single rack is ample. There is a 3 bolt rappel anchor at the top.
content.location: It climbs right up the center of the middle tooth.

content.description:
Start with a hand jam, and work up through the offwidth/chimney. When the climbing eases off, traverse left on a rounded ledge, set a bomber piece, and pull the last couple of heady moves to the top.

This route has seen very few or no ascents. The rock is still sandy, and there is a possibility of loose chockstones.
content.protection: A singles rack. A #4 cam is nice but not necessary. There is a 3 bolt rappel anchor at the top. A 60m rope gets you down...barely!
content.location: This route starts on the right hand side of the gap between the south and middle teeth.

content.description: Start up an easy slab, and follow an ascending narrow crack to the right, passing an old piton. The crack then goes vertical to the top. Build a gear anchor at the top.
content.protection:
A singles rack.

Walk off left down the South Tooth.
content.location: Start on a slab at the right-hand end of the South Tooth.
